Reviews.Title: Amazed by overall photo and build quality + HD!
Reviews.Author: Yarii
Reviews.Content: This camera may be plastic, but it's a high-quality plastic with raised lettering, the build quality is excellent as well as the fit & finish, and the sharpness of the LCD is as good as I've seen on expensive cameras. I own a Panasonic DMC-TZ4 which cost well over $250 in 2008, and this is just as good, if not better, than my TZ4 which I still use, I just don't carry it in my bag as it's too heavy.  This camera is light-weight and easy to toss in a bag, but I do recommend a case.  It keeps your camera looking nice.One thing I want you to note if you don't get anything else from reading my review - the best way to keep your camera from getting a zoom error is to flick the switch on the back to the VIEW images side (green arrow); that way if your camera accidentally gets turned on in your bag, the lens will not open and zoom out. Not all cameras have the slide switch, but all the Panasonic cameras I'm aware of, do have the same type switch.OK, back to the camera.  One thing I like about the LCD screen on this camera is you have a high-angle view choice.  This comes in handy at parades when all the tall people are standing in front of you; all you do is hold your arms up over your head and you can still see what you are shooting at down below.The camera turns on fast, shoots fast, and recovers to take another shot the fastest of any camera I've ever used, and I've used many.  This camera has MEGA Optical Image Stabilization, which is hard to find at this price.  The lithium-ion battery life is excellent, I've shot over 250 pics and movies and it has not needed recharging.  The battery charger comes with the camera, and will charge a dead battery in 90 minutes. Naturally, it also comes with the USB cable, photo-editing software which I don't care for and is not worth installing, and the A/V cable to plug into your TV for viewing photos & videos that way.  BTW, A/V cables aren't being included in the lower-end cameras much anymore, but this camera does have them.Most of the time I leave it on the Intelligent Autofocus (IA) - this dedicated button is located on the top to the right of the shutter release - you can push and go from any other mode to this in an instant - this will let the camera choose on its own any of 6 different scenes so you don't have to decide yourself.  I also like the regular scene modes - one of them you can make yourself skinnier. :)  Another scene selection you can choose one of 3 frames to automatically surround your picture.  Yet another you have a choice of Baby 1 or Baby 2 where you can also add name and age.One of the scene settings is called Flash Burst, where you can take 5 consecutive pics with flash by holding the shutter down; this is a great feature to have if you have a moving object such as a child or pet as you are bound to get at least one good shot out of the five.Picture quality is excellent.  I've taken quite a few shots of my cats (on the pet scene mode) and when enlarged to full screen-view size on my 22" monitor, I can see every strand of fur in great detail.One thing I find to be cute and I've never seen it before:  the little green dot that comes on to show you are focused can be changed from a plain green dot to a heart, a flower, or even a car among other things.  So this may appeal to the younger photographers too.The HD movie quality is excellent, even better than my Flip MinoHD 2nd generation.  The only downfall of the HD movie is the QuickTime format which this camera uses, is an SD card HOG.  I recommend getting a minimum of a 16 GB SDHC CLASS 6 memory card if you plan on taking a lot of HD movies.  If you are just primarily taking photos, a 2 GB or 4 GB card will do fine and they are fairly inexpensive.  And no, you cannot zoom in and out while making a movie.  You can set the zoom before you press the button, but not during.This camera case is a perfect fit:  Lowepro Volta 20 Camera Case (Black)

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA for a Point & Shoot. SOLID BUILD
Reviews.Author: Howard "K. Howard"
Reviews.Content: This camera is fantastic for a pocket size point and shoot. I am a previous Canon elf and Nikon CoolPix owner. Side by side, the Panasonic blows the Canon and Nikon away. A friendly suggestion, Google ¨Canon Powershot lens error¨ & see what you find. I AM SOLD on Panasonic's QUALITY. Photos are excellent, although image quality does suffer some in low light. That being said, this is a problem common to all pocket sized point and shoots. The battery life is very good. I can get 300+ shots on a card before the battery needs a charge. This is assuming you don't keep reviewing your shots every 5 minutes. The more you review your shots, obvously the more battery life you consume. The screen is crisp and clear, controls are well placed and the lens, although not a Leica (On this entry levl model)is still good quality. The 2.7 inch screen is MORE THAN AMPLE to view your shots. Image stabilization works very well, especially when using the zoom. The wide angle also allows for good panoramic shots. The camera build is SOLID and feels so in your hand, however is still light enough that you don't feel like you are carrying a brick in your pocket or on your belt. If you are new to Panasonic, a quick review of the manual and after playing with the controls for 10-15 minutes, you should have no problems understanding the menu's and function settings. At it's current price point, this unit is a steal. So much so that I ordered 3 more for Christmas gifts. Two in Black and one in Silver. We own several Panasonic cameras and love them. Just get one. You will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot and a great price
Reviews.Author: Bay Area Tech Junkie
Reviews.Content: Picked up the silver version for under $120 with free shipping, decided against the black version because scratches don't show on silver and the camera will get scratches.The build quality is pretty good, doesn't feel as solid as the Canon digital Elphs, but it doesn't feel like it's made of cheap plastic either. It is slightly larger all around than say the Canon SD940is, and unlike the Canon SD940is, the flash is positioned in a place where you are unlikely to cover it while holding the camera, a BIG plus. The battery latch mechanism isn't as easy as the Canon, and is really a two handed operation. Controls are pretty comparable, with the Panasonic using a power switch versus a recessed pushbutton on the Canon. Video is enabled via a menu, which in my opinion is not as easy as a physical switch. Overall I'd rate the Canon controls and menus a cut above the Panasonic, but once you are used to them it is okay.There are a lot of shooting options on this camera, and if you want to trust it, there is a big iA button which will attempt to autoselect a mode for you. The camera also continuously focuses even if you don't push the button halfway, which is supposed to speed up the focusing - in practice I found that it likely results in more out of focus pictures than pictures that are focus locked more quickly. I find that I often find myself turning off the flash (it seems to fire in light that is good enough without it) and setting it to Sport mode to force a faster shutter speed. The 5x zoom and optical image stabilization are very nice, but the zoom is slower than the Canon models. At the widest angle you do tend to get some stretching effects across the entire picture, and for pictures of people you might want to actually zoom a little to reduce this effect. The biggest downside to this camera is the start up time; while the viewfinder turns on very quickly, you must wait a good 2 seconds before you are able to actually take a picture.Image quality is very good, and I've taken some pictures that almost have a DSLR quality to them. I'm particularly impressed with how this camera handles bright red colors - it cleary does a better job than my Pentax K100D SLR. However the default color intensity seems dull so I now shoot with the Vivid setting on. It also seems to do a good job with exposures; if it has a weakness it's that bright light sources in high contrast situations can produce a hazing kind of effect. I would also rate the video quality as very good - it is a little grainy, but compared to the HD video shot by the Canon SD940is, this is much better. It shoots motion JPEG in a Quicktime file, but my home PC has no problems being able to play it back.This isn't the perfect camera, but for these features and performance at this price, you basically can't lose. I highly recommend it as a safe bet.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my mother, I'm sure awesome for others!
Reviews.Author: Annie Thompson "annie_thesinger"
Reviews.Content: So I'm the digital camera expert of my family. When anybody wants a new memory maker, I'm the first one who hears about it. My mom wanted a new camera that "snapped the pictures faster and had more color in them". My mom is not very good with technology, so it was important to me to find a camera that was incredibly easy to use and had presets that were very self-explanatory as to what they were used for. I also wanted a camera that had good reviews about being fast (also a class 6 memory card that would be fast). I wanted a camera with a considerable optical zoom range for a limited budget because my mom likes to zoom in on small objects but doesn't understand how much detail is lost when she uses digital zoom. I wanted a camera known to have vibrant capture of color, higher megapixel count so she could make the pictures considerably big without pixelation, and I wanted a camera with HD video. My mother said she didn't care about video, but I knew she'd change her mind once she experienced HD video. Well, I made the right choice. Mom is thrilled. The pictures look great, it's really easy to figure out, and the camera does the work for her while not making her wait. It is much faster than the Kodak Mom did have that she hated. The picture quality is great, colors are brilliant, and the video looks great, too. My mom figured out how to get the pictures off her camera without needing help, which is impressive, because I useally have to show her that too. Most importantly, this camera was just barely within the price range my mom had limited me to, and was a really great price in comparison to other cameras with the same features, so I feel like I got the best possible camera for her within the price range.

Reviews.Title: Compared and bought the Panasonic
Reviews.Author: Kreyfeld70
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased for my wife to slip in her purse so she could take pictures of the grandchildren. It replaced a very old Canon. I have always purchased Canon cameras but in this case, this camera had more to offer than the Canon and at a lessor price. We have been completely satisfied with its performance. We were a little concerned that it has a rechargeable battery and that we couldn't use AA's or AAA's as a back up but we have never run out of battery. A back up battery can be purchased for less than $20 dollars but we haven't needed to. Videos are sharp as well as the stills. In low light, the shutter doesn't respond well and the flash is also slows it down a bit. We are very happy with the purchase.Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH1 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)

Reviews.Title: Very Good Product
Reviews.Author: G. Peterson
Reviews.Content: This camera lives up to all the good reviews I saw on Amazon. The photo quality is great and the HD video is better than my old camcorder.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Rebekah
Reviews.Content: I completely love this camera!  I have young children and my main concern was the quality of video it would have.  I haven't had a good camera in 5 years and didn't want to spend more money on a video camera.  This one does everything I could ask for!!!  The video is great (with audio) and the pictures are amazing!  I am very happy with this purchase and would recommend it to EVERYONE looking for an inexpensive camera!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Many Options, Great in Low Light!
Reviews.Author: gast
Reviews.Content: I have had a Canon Elf and a Sony Powershot before this camera and I like this one far better than them both. It is easy to use and has many shooting options to choose from and adjust to get the picture lighting that you want within your shots.

Reviews.Title: Love it-don't let the low price fool you into thinking it's not quality
Reviews.Author: cab1974
Reviews.Content: I first purchased a Panasonic Lumix several years ago (for more than $200). I don't remember the model number and Panasonic no longer manufactures it, but this is what they recommended as a very similar replacement.  I love this one as much as the first. Great pictures, zoom does not distory picture. I have a 6 year old and even when she moves just before the flash goes off, it almost always catches her and doesn't blur. Tons of other options.Panasonic also has amazing customer service, even if you don't purchase through them.  Dean on the customer service line spent more than 30 minutes with me explaining my options. He was very gracious when I told him that I was going to purchase through Amazon, rather than Panasonic (because of the free shipping and the slightly lower price- $10 or something) and encouraged me to call back if I had questions or problem.This is a great camera- don't be fooled by the low price!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: And G
Reviews.Content: It's been some years now, and still takes great pictures !  Excellent choice for a point and shoot camera. I definitely recommend it !

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: A. Bauco
Reviews.Content: Son likes it.  Easy to use.  Realiable.  Takes good pictures.  Good value.  Good performance.  Small.  Panasonic makes very good point and click cameras.

Reviews.Title: bought two
Reviews.Author: Laur Land
Reviews.Content: I liked this camera so much and the price was right, I bought a second one for my parents.  It's pretty darn nice for a point and shoot.  Lumix makes good cameras.  I did take some creative artsy photos that came out wonderfully.  As for every day picture captures, it's not AMAZING but it does the job and the shots are clear and it's easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Lumix FH1
Reviews.Author: L. Acosta "LA"
Reviews.Content: Very simple and easy to use, perfect for travel and general picture taking, many good options for the money. Checked big box stores prices were cheaper but not the same model, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: My First Camera
Reviews.Author: beckaroony
Reviews.Content: This was the first camera I have bought for myself.  I've never been much of a picture taker, but decided I'm probably missing out on a lot of good memories.  It works great!  I just haven't got used to it yet.  I bought a case, screen protector, and two extra batteries.  I have read that some batteries other than Panasonic don't work properly, but I purchased two Wasabi Power(LCH-BCF10) batteries and charger on e-Bay for less than or the same price as one Panasonic battery!  They work just fine and are supposed to last a little longer the original Panasonic battery.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic D camera
Reviews.Author: S. Gray
Reviews.Content: This camera is light weight, pictures are very clear, the LCD is large. This camera has anti-shake, which is perfect for anyone who has a bit of nervous issues. I highly recommend this camera

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Shane
Reviews.Content: It's a nice camera. Especially the price is good, just 89 bucks.My friends appreciate the quality of my photos in facebook :D.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Erik W. Davidson "Erik D"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for my mother-in-law for Christmas.  She wanted something simple with a big display.  For the money you can't go wrong with this camera.  Remember however it is an entry level camera, so don't expect too much.  She absolutely loves the thing!

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with this little camera
Reviews.Author: Lindy Lou
Reviews.Content: Exactly as described.  Perfect small-sized camera for an upcoming trip where you're not allowed a bulky one.  Already have a larger Lumix and this one seems just as good although without the range of zoom that the larger one has.  Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: panasonic lumix easy, fast, and sharp
Reviews.Author: Laurence D. Lehman
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd purchase of a panasonic lumix and this model (dmc-fh1)  is even better than the last camera.  It is so easy to understand the controls and settings and super easy to use for very sharp photos.  The camera is so small it will easily fit in any shirt pocket.  this is the best small digital camera that I have used.  The flash mode is very easy to set and use as was the macro settig which I use often.  The lcd is plenty large and sharp and frames the shots perfectly.  The shutter has no hestitation like most older digital cameras and auto focuses quickly for fast shots.  I rate it highly and would recommend it to anyone who want's a useful compact great camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Ronsy
Reviews.Content: My wife needed a small camera for the purse so this was perfect for Her. Even though it is 12MP you can take great pics with it at the 5mp setting even up to 8x10. It recharges quickly & takes great pics & feels solid.

Reviews.Title: Get the DMC-FH3
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "the admiral"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this and it seemed to take fine pictures when I viewed them on the camera. When I uploaded them to my PC the images were awful. Very light and not very sharp. I then ordered the DMC-FH3 because the Lumix line seemed to be getting rave reviews overall. The DMC-FH3 takes very clear pictures. That is the camera I will be keeping. Both the FH1 and FH3 took very good video, even when watched on an HDTV. Pay the extra $20 and go for the FH3. I also tested the GE A1455 and the HP PW460T, neither compare to the FH3.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: J. Mcghee "V_RocKs"
Reviews.Content: All I can say to people that have blurry photos or off colors is that you bought a dud. As more and more manufacturing is going on overseas you are going to encounter them more and more often. As a society we have to send this stuff back and get our replacements or a refund. Don't settle for an inferior product. The camera I received was not a dud and if the zoom motor or anything else stops working I will contact the manufacturer and demand a replacement or a repair.

Reviews.Title: ENVIAR RAPIDO - TO SEND RAPIDLY
Reviews.Author: HERNAN MOLINA
Reviews.Content: I NEED THAT THEY TAKE THE SHORT ONE OF THE RAPID SENDING OF MY CARD OF CREDIT, DUE TO THE FACT THAT THE DATE GIVES 4 GIVE APRIL IT IS VERY LATE. THANK YOUNECESITO QUE ME TOMEN EL CORTO DEL ENVIO RAPIDO DE MI TARJETA DE CREDITO, DEBIDO A QUE LA FECHA DE 4 DE ABRIL ES MUY TARDE. GRACIAS

Reviews.Title: Muy buena!!!!
Reviews.Author: ENDERWIN "ENDERSIL"
Reviews.Content: La cámara superó todas mis espectativas, las fotos salen excelentes, y la calidad del video HD es insuperable.  El precio es lo bastante accesible para la calidad de la cámara.  Lo único que no posee es la posibilidad de mostrar en la foto la fecha y hora la cual fue tomada, en lo particular no es importante, pero sería bueno tener esta opción.  Creo que supera con creces las otras cámaras de su precio!!!

Reviews.Title: happy with camera
Reviews.Author: Alan Winters
Reviews.Content: I used to shlep my big canon, which takes great pics, but there are too many buttons.  This camera is less adaptable, but is much much smaller and easy to use and takes good pics.

Reviews.Title: 12.1MP Lumix DMC-FH1
Reviews.Author: Lee
Reviews.Content: Great camera at a great price. Although price is entry, the pictures are pretty great.

Reviews.Title: average user
Reviews.Author: R. Alexander
Reviews.Content: great price from 6th Ave, fast delivery, easy to use, produces excellent pictures, 5X tele is great

Reviews.Title: Photo Quality Does not compare well
Reviews.Author: Gerald Huchital
Reviews.Content: Enticed by the low price, ordered this camera as a replacement for an old Canon SD 1000. In side to side tests, the Canon took better photos by far. Decided that in this case you really do get what you pay for. Returned camera

Reviews.Title: Don't be fooled!
Reviews.Author: K. Wolff
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a simple p & s for my in laws-was impressed with the ratings even though I have never used a lumix before.  I purchased this and quickly returned it!  I tried to take a couple pics with it to make sure it was acceptable before giving as a gift.  The closeups were ok but when I tried to zoom a couple feet the pictures were beyond terrible!  I've seen a cell phone take better pictures!  I did try different modes but they were all bad.  So I sent this back and decided to get a Canon A3100 IS.  Hopefully that one will be much better-will review it later.Got my Canon and I'm so relieved and happy-what a world of difference!  I love it-I knew I could count on Canon!  You cannot beat this camera for under $100!
